R25.nl_constraint: The rock sample at waypoint6 should never be collected

children.nl_constraint: The rock sample at waypoint6 must always remain present at that location throughout the entire mission.

content.text:
<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain rover)
       (:requirements :typing :fluents)
       (:types
              rover -object
              waypoint -object
              store -object
              camera -object
              mode -object
              lander -object
              objective -object
       )
       (:predicates
              (in ?x - rover ?y - waypoint)
              (at_lander ?x - lander ?y - waypoint)
              (can_traverse ?r - rover ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              (equipped_for_soil_analysis ?r - rover)
              (equipped_for_rock_analysis ?r - rover)
              (equipped_for_imaging ?r - rover)
              (empty ?s - store)
              (have_rock_analysis ?r - rover ?w - waypoint)
              (have_soil_analysis ?r - rover ?w - waypoint)
              (full ?s - store)
              (calibrated ?c - camera ?r - rover)
              (supports ?c - camera ?m - mode)
              (available ?r - rover)
              (visible ?w - waypoint ?p - waypoint)
              (have_image ?r - rover ?o - objective ?m - mode)
              (communicated_soil_data ?w - waypoint)
              (communicated_rock_data ?w - waypoint)
              (communicated_image_data ?o - objective ?m - mode)
              (at_soil_sample ?w - waypoint)
              (at_rock_sample ?w - waypoint)
              (visible_from ?o - objective ?w - waypoint)
              (store_of ?s - store ?r - rover)
              (calibration_target ?i - camera ?o - objective)
              (on_board ?i - camera ?r - rover)
              (channel_free ?l - lander)
              (in_sun ?w - waypoint)
       )

       (:functions
              (energy ?r - rover)
              (recharges)
              (total-energy-used)
              (n_navigate ?x - rover ?y - waypoint ?z - waypoint)
              (n_recharge ?x - rover ?w - waypoint)
              (n_samplesoil ?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              (n_samplerock ?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              (n_drop ?x - rover ?y - store)
              (n_calibrate ?r - rover ?i - camera ?t - objective ?w - waypoint)
              (n_takeimage ?r - rover ?p - waypoint ?o - objective ?i - camera ?m - mode)
              (n_communicatesoildata ?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              (n_communicaterockdata ?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              (n_communicateimagedata ?r - rover ?l - lander ?o - objective ?m - mode ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
       )

       (:action navigate
              :parameters (?x - rover ?y - waypoint ?z - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (can_traverse ?x ?y ?z) (available ?x) (in ?x ?y)
                     (visible ?y ?z) (>= (energy ?x) 8)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 8)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 8)
                     (not (in ?x ?y))
                     (in ?x ?z)
                     (increase (n_navigate ?x ?y ?z) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action recharge
              :parameters (?x - rover ?w - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?x ?w) (in_sun ?w) (<= (energy ?x) 80))
              :effect (and (increase (energy ?x) 20) (increase (recharges) 1)
                     (increase (n_recharge ?x ?w) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action samplesoil
              :parameters (?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?x ?p)
                     (>= (energy ?x) 3) (at_soil_sample ?p) (equipped_for_soil_analysis ?x) (store_of ?s ?x) (empty ?s)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (not (empty ?s))
                     (full ?s)
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 3)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 3)
                     (have_soil_analysis ?x ?p)
                     (not (at_soil_sample ?p))
                     (increase (n_samplesoil ?x ?s ?p) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action samplerock
              :parameters (?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?x ?p) (>= (energy ?x) 5)
                     (at_rock_sample ?p) (equipped_for_rock_analysis ?x) (store_of ?s ?x)(empty ?s)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (not (empty ?s))
                     (full ?s)
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 5)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 5)
                     (have_rock_analysis ?x ?p)
                     (not (at_rock_sample ?p))
                     (increase (n_samplerock ?x ?s ?p) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action drop
              :parameters (?x - rover ?y - store)
              :precondition (and (store_of ?y ?x) (full ?y) (>= (energy ?x) 1)
              )
              :effect (and (not (full ?y)) (empty ?y)
                     (increase (n_drop ?x ?y) 1)
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 1)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action calibrate
              :parameters (?r - rover ?i - camera ?t - objective ?w - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (equipped_for_imaging ?r) (>= (energy ?r) 2)(calibration_target ?i ?t) (in ?r ?w) (visible_from ?t ?w)(on_board ?i ?r)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 2)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 2)
                     (calibrated ?i ?r)
                     (increase (n_calibrate ?r ?i ?t ?w) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action takeimage
              :parameters (?r - rover ?p - waypoint ?o - objective ?i - camera ?m - mode)
              :precondition (and (calibrated ?i ?r)
                     (on_board ?i ?r)
                     (equipped_for_imaging ?r)
                     (supports ?i ?m)
                     (visible_from ?o ?p)
                     (in ?r ?p)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 1)
              )
              :effect (and (have_image ?r ?o ?m)
                     (not (calibrated ?i ?r))
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 1)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 1)
                     (increase (n_takeimage ?r ?p ?o ?i ?m) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action communicatesoildata
              :parameters (?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?r ?x)
                     (at_lander ?l ?y)(have_soil_analysis ?r ?p)
                     (visible ?x ?y)(available ?r)(channel_free ?l)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 4)
              )
              :effect (and (communicated_soil_data ?p)(available ?r)
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 4)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 4)
                     (increase
                            (n_communicatesoildata ?r ?l ?p ?x ?y)
                            1)
              )
       )

       (:action communicaterockdata
              :parameters (?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?r ?x)
                     (at_lander ?l ?y)(have_rock_analysis ?r ?p)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 4)
                     (visible ?x ?y)(available ?r)(channel_free ?l)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (communicated_rock_data ?p)(available ?r)
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 4)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 4)
                     (increase
                            (n_communicaterockdata ?r ?l ?p ?x ?y)
                            1)
              )
       )

       (:action communicateimagedata
              :parameters (?r - rover ?l - lander ?o - objective ?m - mode ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?r ?x)
                     (at_lander ?l ?y)(have_image ?r ?o ?m)(visible ?x ?y)(available ?r)(channel_free ?l)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 6)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (communicated_image_data ?o ?m)(available ?r)
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 6)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 6)
                     (increase
                            (n_communicateimagedata ?r ?l ?o ?m ?x ?y)
                            1)
              )
       )
)
</pddl_domain>

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
The rock sample at waypoint6 must always remain present at that location throughout the entire mission.
</user_input>

The user wants me to translate the constraint "The rock sample at waypoint6 must always remain present at that location throughout the entire mission" into PDDL3.0.

Let me think about this:

1. The constraint is about the rock sample at waypoint6 remaining present throughout the entire mission.

2. Looking at the domain, I can see there's a predicate `(at_rock_sample ?w - waypoint)` which indicates that there's a rock sample at waypoint `?w`.

3. In the initial state, I can see `(at_rock_sample waypoint6)` is true.

4. The constraint says this must "always" remain true throughout the entire mission.

5. In PDDL3.0, temporal logic operators include:
   - `always` - something must be true in all states
   - `sometime` - something must be true in at least one state
   - `at-most-once` - something can be true at most once
   - `sometime-after` - something must be true sometime after another condition
   - `sometime-before` - something must be true sometime before another condition
   - `always-within` - something must always be true within a time window
   - etc.

6. Since the constraint says the rock sample "must always remain present", this sounds like I need to use the `always` operator.

7. The constraint would be: `(always (at_rock_sample waypoint6))`

This means that in all states of the plan, the predicate `(at_rock_sample waypoint6)` must be true.

<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain rover)
       (:requirements :typing :fluents)
       (:types
              rover -object
              waypoint -object
              store -object
              camera -object
              mode -object
              lander -object
              objective -object
       )
       (:predicates
              (in ?x - rover ?y - waypoint)
              (at_lander ?x - lander ?y - waypoint)
              (can_traverse ?r - rover ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              (equipped_for_soil_analysis ?r - rover)
              (equipped_for_rock_analysis ?r - rover)
              (equipped_for_imaging ?r - rover)
              (empty ?s - store)
              (have_rock_analysis ?r - rover ?w - waypoint)
              (have_soil_analysis ?r - rover ?w - waypoint)
              (full ?s - store)
              (calibrated ?c - camera ?r - rover)
              (supports ?c - camera ?m - mode)
              (available ?r - rover)
              (visible ?w - waypoint ?p - waypoint)
              (have_image ?r - rover ?o - objective ?m - mode)
              (communicated_soil_data ?w - waypoint)
              (communicated_rock_data ?w - waypoint)
              (communicated_image_data ?o - objective ?m - mode)
              (at_soil_sample ?w - waypoint)
              (at_rock_sample ?w - waypoint)
              (visible_from ?o - objective ?w - waypoint)
              (store_of ?s - store ?r - rover)
              (calibration_target ?i - camera ?o - objective)
              (on_board ?i - camera ?r - rover)
              (channel_free ?l - lander)
              (in_sun ?w - waypoint)
       )

       (:functions
              (energy ?r - rover)
              (recharges)
              (total-energy-used)
              (n_navigate ?x - rover ?y - waypoint ?z - waypoint)
              (n_recharge ?x - rover ?w - waypoint)
              (n_samplesoil ?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              (n_samplerock ?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              (n_drop ?x - rover ?y - store)
              (n_calibrate ?r - rover ?i - camera ?t - objective ?w - waypoint)
              (n_takeimage ?r - rover ?p - waypoint ?o - objective ?i - camera ?m - mode)
              (n_communicatesoildata ?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              (n_communicaterockdata ?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              (n_communicateimagedata ?r - rover ?l - lander ?o - objective ?m - mode ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
       )

       (:action navigate
              :parameters (?x - rover ?y - waypoint ?z - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (can_traverse ?x ?y ?z) (available ?x) (in ?x ?y)
                     (visible ?y ?z) (>= (energy ?x) 8)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 8)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 8)
                     (not (in ?x ?y))
                     (in ?x ?z)
                     (increase (n_navigate ?x ?y ?z) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action recharge
              :parameters (?x - rover ?w - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?x ?w) (in_sun ?w) (<= (energy ?x) 80))
              :effect (and (increase (energy ?x) 20) (increase (recharges) 1)
                     (increase (n_recharge ?x ?w) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action samplesoil
              :parameters (?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?x ?p)
                     (>= (energy ?x) 3) (at_soil_sample ?p) (equipped_for_soil_analysis ?x) (store_of ?s ?x) (empty ?s)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (not (empty ?s))
                     (full ?s)
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 3)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 3)
                     (have_soil_analysis ?x ?p)
                     (not (at_soil_sample ?p))
                     (increase (n_samplesoil ?x ?s ?p) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action samplerock
              :parameters (?x - rover ?s - store ?p - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?x ?p) (>= (energy ?x) 5)
                     (at_rock_sample ?p) (equipped_for_rock_analysis ?x) (store_of ?s ?x)(empty ?s)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (not (empty ?s))
                     (full ?s)
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 5)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 5)
                     (have_rock_analysis ?x ?p)
                     (not (at_rock_sample ?p))
                     (increase (n_samplerock ?x ?s ?p) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action drop
              :parameters (?x - rover ?y - store)
              :precondition (and (store_of ?y ?x) (full ?y) (>= (energy ?x) 1)
              )
              :effect (and (not (full ?y)) (empty ?y)
                     (increase (n_drop ?x ?y) 1)
                     (decrease (energy ?x) 1)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action calibrate
              :parameters (?r - rover ?i - camera ?t - objective ?w - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (equipped_for_imaging ?r) (>= (energy ?r) 2)(calibration_target ?i ?t) (in ?r ?w) (visible_from ?t ?w)(on_board ?i ?r)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 2)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 2)
                     (calibrated ?i ?r)
                     (increase (n_calibrate ?r ?i ?t ?w) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action takeimage
              :parameters (?r - rover ?p - waypoint ?o - objective ?i - camera ?m - mode)
              :precondition (and (calibrated ?i ?r)
                     (on_board ?i ?r)
                     (equipped_for_imaging ?r)
                     (supports ?i ?m)
                     (visible_from ?o ?p)
                     (in ?r ?p)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 1)
              )
              :effect (and (have_image ?r ?o ?m)
                     (not (calibrated ?i ?r))
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 1)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 1)
                     (increase (n_takeimage ?r ?p ?o ?i ?m) 1)
              )
       )

       (:action communicatesoildata
              :parameters (?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?r ?x)
                     (at_lander ?l ?y)(have_soil_analysis ?r ?p)
                     (visible ?x ?y)(available ?r)(channel_free ?l)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 4)
              )
              :effect (and (communicated_soil_data ?p)(available ?r)
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 4)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 4)
                     (increase
                            (n_communicatesoildata ?r ?l ?p ?x ?y)
                            1)
              )
       )

       (:action communicaterockdata
              :parameters (?r - rover ?l - lander ?p - waypoint ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?r ?x)
                     (at_lander ?l ?y)(have_rock_analysis ?r ?p)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 4)
                     (visible ?x ?y)(available ?r)(channel_free ?l)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (communicated_rock_data ?p)(available ?r)
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 4)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 4)
                     (increase
                            (n_communicaterockdata ?r ?l ?p ?x ?y)
                            1)
              )
       )

       (:action communicateimagedata
              :parameters (?r - rover ?l - lander ?o - objective ?m - mode ?x - waypoint ?y - waypoint)
              :precondition (and (in ?r ?x)
                     (at_lander ?l ?y)(have_image ?r ?o ?m)(visible ?x ?y)(available ?r)(channel_free ?l)
                     (>= (energy ?r) 6)
              )
              :effect (and
                     (communicated_image_data ?o ?m)(available ?r)
                     (decrease (energy ?r) 6)
                     (increase (total-energy-used) 6)
                     (increase
                            (n_communicateimagedata ?r ?l ?o ?m ?x ?y)
                            1)
              )
       )
)
</pddl_domain>

<information>
The user will give as input a constraint in natural language. This constraint must be used as a transjectory hard constraint for the solution plan of the given the PDDL problem. 
</information>

<instructions> 
- Refine the user constraint to make it applicable to the given PDDL problem.
- You can rephrase and decompose the initial constraint into several other contraints.
- These constraints should be complementary and they will be later combined with AND operators.
- Constraints must be state-based and follow a Linear Temporal Logic. So constraints can't directly refer to actions.
- Avoid explicit PDDL language in your answer, the user can't understand PDDL.
- The set of all refined constraints must capture the meaning of the initial user constraint. 
- Format your answer as a clear and concise numbered list between the tags <constraints> and </constraints>. There should be no subitems, only the list of refined constraints.
- After, add 1 or 2 sentences to explain your choice of decomposition between the tags <explanation> and </explanation>.
- Here is an example of how to format your answer:
    <constraints>
        1. [natural_language_constraint_1]
        2. [natural_language_constraint_2]
        ...
    </constraints>
    <explanation>
        [consice_explanation]
    </explanation>
</instructions>

<user_input>
The rock sample at waypoint6 should never be collected
</user_input>

Let me analyze the user constraint: "The rock sample at waypoint6 should never be collected"

Looking at the PDDL problem, I can see that:
- There is a rock sample at waypoint6: `(at_rock_sample waypoint6)`
- The goal includes `(communicated_rock_data waypoint0)`, `(communicated_rock_data waypoint1)`, `(communicated_rock_data waypoint3)`, and `(communicated_rock_data waypoint4)`, but NOT waypoint6
- So the constraint is asking that the rock sample at waypoint6 should never be collected

In PDDL terms, this means that the predicate `(at_rock_sample waypoint6)` should always remain true throughout the entire plan execution. When a rock sample is collected through the `samplerock` action, the effect includes `(not (at_rock_sample ?p))` where ?p is the waypoint.

So the constraint in natural language would be that the rock sample must always remain at waypoint6 - it should never be removed/collected.

Since I need to avoid explicit PDDL language and make it state-based following Linear Temporal Logic, I should phrase this as:

1. The rock sample at waypoint6 must always remain available at that location throughout the entire mission.

This captures the essence that the rock sample should never be collected. I could also phrase it as:

1. Throughout the entire mission execution, there must always be a rock sample present at waypoint6.

Or I could be more specific:

1. The rock sample at waypoint6 must never be removed or collected by any rover.

I think the clearest way is to state it as the rock sample always remaining available/present at waypoint6.

Let me think if this needs to be decomposed into multiple constraints. The user constraint is quite simple and specific - it's about one specific rock sample at one specific waypoint never being collected. I don't think this needs to be decomposed into multiple constraints since it's already very specific and clear.
 
I'll formulate the constraint to emphasize the rock sample's persistent presence at waypoint6, ensuring it remains untouched throughout the mission's duration. The key is maintaining the sample's location as an invariant condition, preventing any rover from collecting or moving it.

<constraints>
1. The rock sample at waypoint6 must always remain present at that location throughout the entire mission.
</constraints>

<explanation>
This constraint directly captures the user's requirement by ensuring that the rock sample at waypoint6 is never removed from its location, effectively preventing any rover from collecting it during the mission execution.
</explanation>
